content:
"An audience, a movie, and you’re all in it together. You’re frightened, you laugh, you cry all together. So it’s a communal thing. And that’s beginning to disappear."
I can't speak for everyone, but when I go to a movie, any enjoyment I have is in spite of the audience. It's certainly not a communal thing. And thank God. If it was, I'd stay as far away from it as I could.
The only thing I value in the cinema experience is the massive screen and completely immersive sound, which I simply can't duplicate in my home theater. As for the audience, with 4 rowdy kids, I get about the same experience at home as in the theater, so that's a push.
